   19: %%
   20: -module(ssl_key_update_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -behaviour(ct_suite).
   23: 
   24: %% Callback functions
   25: -export([all/0,
   26:          groups/0,
   27:          init_per_suite/1,
   28:          end_per_suite/1,
   29:          init_per_group/2,
   30:          end_per_group/2,
   31:          init_per_testcase/2,
   32:          end_per_testcase/2]).
   33: 
   34: %% Testcases
   35: -export([key_update_at_client/0,
   36:          key_update_at_client/1,
   37:          key_update_at_server/0,
   38:          key_update_at_server/1,
   39:          explicit_key_update/0,
   40:          explicit_key_update/1]).
   41: 
   42: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_api.hrl").
   45: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_connection.hrl").
   46: all() ->
   47:     [{group, 'tlsv1.3'}].
   48: 
   49: groups() ->
   50:     [{'tlsv1.3', [], tls_1_3_tests()}].
   51: 
   52: tls_1_3_tests() ->
   53:     [key_update_at_client,
   54:      key_update_at_server,
   55:      explicit_key_update].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   58:     catch crypto:stop(),
   59:     try crypto:start() of
   60:         ok ->
   61:             ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
   62:             case proplists:get_bool(ecdh, proplists:get_value(public_keys, crypto:supports())) of
   63:                 true ->
   64:                     ssl_test_lib:make_ecdsa_cert(Config0);
   65:                 false ->
   66:                     {skip, "Missing EC crypto support"}
   67:             end
   68:     catch _:_ ->
   69:             {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
   70:     end.
   71: 
   72: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   73:     ssl:stop(),
   74:     application:unload(ssl),
   75:     application:stop(crypto).
   76: 
   77: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
   78:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
   79: 
   80: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
   81:   ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
   82: 
   83: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   84:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
   85:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
   86:     Config.
   87: 
   88: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   89:     Config.
   90: 
   91: 
   92: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   93: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
   94: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   95: key_update_at_client() ->
   96:     [{doc,"Test option 'key_update_at' between erlang client and erlang server."
   97:       "Client initiating the update."}].
   98: key_update_at_client(Config) ->
   99:     key_update_at(Config, client).
  100: 
  101: key_update_at_server() ->
  102:     [{doc,"Test option 'key_update_at' between erlang client and erlang server."
  103:       "Server initiating the update."}].
  104: key_update_at_server(Config) ->
  105:     key_update_at(Config, server).
  106: 
  107: key_update_at(Config, Role) ->
  108:     Data = "123456789012345",  %% 15 bytes
  109:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server(erlang,
  110:                                        [{options, [{keep_secrets, true},
  111:                                                    {key_update_at, 14}]}],
  112:                                        Config),
  113:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  114:     ClientResult = ssl_test_lib:start_client(erlang,
  115:                                              [return_socket, {port, Port},
  116:                                               {options, [{keep_secrets, true},
  117:                                                          {key_update_at, 14}]}],
  118:                                              Config),
  119:     {Client, ClientSocket} = ClientResult,
  120:     Server ! get_socket,
  121:     ServerSocket = receive
  122:                        {Server, {socket, S}} -> S
  123:                    end,
  124:     Keys0 = get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket),
  125:     ?CT_LOG("connected", []),
  126:     {Sender, Receiver} = case Role of
  127:                              client -> {Client, Server};
  128:                              server -> {Server, Client}
  129:                          end,
  130:     %% Sending bytes over limit triggers key update
  131:     ssl_test_lib:send(Sender, Data),
  132:     Data = ssl_test_lib:check_active_receive(Receiver, Data),
  133:     %% TODO check if key has been updated (needs debug logging of secrets)
  134:     ct:sleep(500),
  135:     ?CT_LOG("sent and waited", []),
  136:     Keys1 = get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket),
  137:     verify_key_update(Keys0, Keys1),
  138:     %% Test mechanism to prevent infinite loop of key updates
  139:     BigData = binary:copy(<<"1234567890">>, 10),  %% 100 bytes
  140:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Sender, BigData),
  141:     ct:sleep(500),
  142:     ?CT_LOG("sent and waited 2", []),
  143:     Keys2 = get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket),
  144:     verify_key_update(Keys1, Keys2),
  145:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  146:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  147: 
  148: get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket) ->
  149:     ProcessSocket =
  150:         fun(Socket, Role) ->
  151:                 {ok, [{keylog, KeyLog}]} = ssl:connection_information(Socket, [keylog]),
  152:                 Interesting =
  153:                     fun(S) ->
  154:                             Patterns = ["CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET", "SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET"],
  155:                             SearchResults = [string:find(S, P) || P <- Patterns],
  156:                             lists:any(fun(I) -> I /= nomatch end, SearchResults)
  157:                     end,
  158:                 TrafficSecrets = lists:filter(Interesting, KeyLog),
  159:                 Print = fun(Secret) ->
  160:                                 [Name, _A, B] = string:lexemes(Secret, " "),
  161:                                 [Key] = io_lib:format("~s", [B]),
  162:                                 {Name, {Role, Key}}
  163:                         end,
  164:                 [Print(Scr) || Scr <- TrafficSecrets]
  165:         end,
  166:     Secrets = lists:flatten(
  167:                 [ProcessSocket(S, R) ||
  168:                     {S, R} <-
  169:                         [{ClientSocket, client}, {ServerSocket, server}]]),
  170:     P = fun(Direction) ->
  171:                 Vals = proplists:get_all_values(Direction, Secrets),
  172:                 ?CT_LOG("~30s ~10s(c) ~10s(s)",
  173:                      [Direction, proplists:get_value(client, Vals),
  174:                       proplists:get_value(server, Vals)]),
  175:                 {Direction, [proplists:get_value(client, Vals),
  176:                              proplists:get_value(server, Vals)]}
  177:         end,
  178:     [P(Direction) ||
  179:         Direction <-
  180:             ["CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", "SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0"]].
  181: 
  182: verify_key_update(Keys0, Keys1) ->
  183:     CTS0 = proplists:get_value("CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys0),
  184:     CTS1 = proplists:get_value("CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys1),
  185:     STS0 = proplists:get_value("SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys0),
  186:     STS1 = proplists:get_value("SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys1),
  187:     CTS = lists:zip(CTS0, CTS1),
  188:     STS = lists:zip(STS0, STS1),
  189:     Pred = fun({A, B}) when A == B ->
  190:                    ct:fail(no_key_update),
  191:                    false;
  192:               (_) ->
  193:                    true
  194:            end,
  195:     [true = lists:all(Pred, X) || X <- [CTS, STS]].
  196: 
  197: explicit_key_update() ->
  198:     [{doc,"Test ssl:update_key/2 between erlang client and erlang server."}].
  199: 
  200: explicit_key_update(Config) ->
  201:     Data = "123456789012345",  %% 15 bytes
  202: 
  203:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server(erlang, [], Config),
  204:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  205: 
  206:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client(erlang, [{port, Port}], Config),
  207:     ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result_active(Client, Server, Data),
  208: 
  209:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Client, write),
  210:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Client, read_write),
  211:     ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result_active(Client, Server, Data),
  212: 
  213:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Server, write),
  214:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Server, read_write),
  215:     ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result_active(Client, Server, Data),
  216:     %% TODO check if key has been updated (needs debug logging of secrets)
  217: 
  218:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  219:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
